meanings.definition: The act of amassing or gathering a large quantity of something.
meanings.sent1: Her amassments of seashells filled the entire shelf.
meanings.sent2: The amassments of books in the library were overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: His amassments of candy made him the most popular kid in school.
meanings.sent4: The amassments of knowledge in his mind were like a treasure trove.
meanings.sent5: The amassments of toys in the playroom created a colorful mess.

meanings.definition: A large collection or accumulation of items or wealth.
meanings.sent1: The antique shop displayed unique amassments of old coins.
meanings.sent2: Her amassments of jewelry sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The magician's amassments of tricks never failed to amuse the audience.
meanings.sent4: The garden was an amassments of colorful flowers in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: The museum showcased an impressive amassments of historical artifacts.
